snippet: To help ward off corporate data breaches, Lookout is using its app to slip under the door of enterprises via the employees who regularly bring their personal devices to work.
abstract: Tech firm Lookout's free mobile security app is aimed at protecting data of corporate customers that allow employees to use their own mobile devices on corporate networks; app has been downloaded by 45 million people worldwide; almost half of companies that allow personally owned devices to connect to corporate network have experienced data breach, either because of unwitting mistakes by employees or intentional wrongdoing.
lead_paragraph: To help ward off corporate data breaches, Lookout is using its app to slip under the door of enterprises via the employees who regularly bring their personal devices to work.

headline.main: Bolstering a Phone’s Defenses Against Breaches
